title: IGNITE-13208 : Simplify IgniteSpiOperationTimeoutHelper
IGNITE-13109 Skip distributed metastorage entries that can not be unmarshalled
body:
Introduced the property that allows to skip distributed metastorage entries that can be unmarshalled when migrating from the previous cluster persistence data.

Entries skipped for:
- notify listeners by key prefix on startup
- node join procedure (values will not be validated)
- iterate with entry key prefix

title: IGNITE-13205 : Represent in logs, javadoc affection of several node addresses on failure detection.
body: Current TcpDiscoverySpi can prolong detection of node failure which has several IP addresses. Actual failure detection delay is: `failureDetectionTimeout * addresses_number`. This PR suggests representing this affection on failure detection to be noted in the logs, javadoc.

title: Ignite 13040
body:
changes:
1. "TcpDiscoveryAbstractMessage msg" parameter removed from TcpDiscoverySpi.writeToSocket()
2. writeToSocket() method calls updated in ServerImpl, TcpDiscoverySpi classes
3. tests updated:

a)
 @Override protected void writeToSocket(Socket sock, TcpDiscoveryAbstractMessage msg, byte[] data, long timeout)
replaced with 
@Override protected void writeToSocket(Socket sock, TcpDiscoveryAbstractMessage msg, byte[] data, long timeout)
in IgniteClientRejoinTest, IgniteCacheTopologySplitAbstractTest, IgniteTcpCommunicationConnectOnInitTest, TcpDiscoveryFailedJoinTest, TcpDiscoveryPendingMessageDeliveryTest,
FailDiscoverySpi, BlockTcpDiscoverySpi, TcpClientDiscoverySpiFailureTimeoutSelfTest, TcpClientDiscoverySpiSelfTest, TcpDiscoveryCoordinatorFailureTest

b) TcpDiscoveryConnectionCheckMessage is used as a stub instead of  msg which was passed via a method parameter  to update last-sent-time to avoid segmentation on connRecoveryTimeout.

title: IGNITE-13005: Spring Data 2 - "JPA style" and working with multiple Ignite instances on same JVM
body:
- Supports multiple Ignite instances on same JVM (@RepositoryConfig).
- Supports query tuning parameters in @Query annotation
- Supports projections
- Supports Page and Stream responses
- Supports Sql Fields Query resultset transformation into the domain entity
- Supports named parameters (:myParam) into SQL queries, declared using @Param("myParam")
- Supports advanced parameter binding and SpEL expressions into SQL queries:
- Template variables:
    - #entityName - the simple class name of the domain entity
- Method parameter expressions: Parameters are exposed for indexed access ([0] is the first query method's param) or via the name declared using @Param. The actual SpEL expression binding is triggered by ?#. Example: ?#{[0] or ?#{#myParamName}
- Advanced SpEL expressions: While advanced parameter binding is a very useful feature, the real power of SpEL stems from the fact, that the expressions can refer to framework abstractions or other application components through SpEL EvaluationContext extension model.
- Supports SpEL expressions into Text queries (TextQuery).

1. Added arm64 with jdk 8 and 11. Openjdk-8-jdk is installed and PATH and JAVA_HOME is set according to it.
2. Installed maven for arm64 jobs.

Signed-off-by: odidev <odidev@puresoftware.com>

title: IGNITE-13031 .NET: Allow SqlFieldsQuery as ContinuousQuery.InitialQuery
body:
* Add `IContinuousQueryHandleFields QueryContinuous(ContinuousQuery<TK, TV> qry, SqlFieldsQuery initialQry)` to `ICache<TK, TV>`
* Fix continuous query getting stuck when initial query fails
* Allow retrieving `fieldsMeta` from initial query for fields queries

`SqlQuery` has been deprecated in favor of `SqlFieldsQuery`, but `ContinuousQuery.InitialQuery` does not allow `SqlFieldsQuery`, so a whole use case became impossible.

`SqlFieldsQuery` is different from all other Ignite queries: the cursor returns an arbitrary set of fields instead of `ICacheEntry<K, V>`, so fields queries are treated in a special way.

title: IGNITE-13134: Fix connection recovery timout.
body: If node experiences connection issues it must establish new connection or fail within `failureDetectionTimeout + connectionRecoveryTimout`. `connectionRecoveryTimout` could be violated. This PR fixes it.

title: IGNITE-6499 : Compact NULL fields binary representation
body:
To compress binary objects, this patch does the following:
In the case of standard objects (Not implementing Binarylizable or Externalizble) (though the nested objects can):
- It removes the 0x65 that encode null within the object
- It removes the offset from the foot to null objects.
- It adds a null mask at the end of the footer in which each bit is set for non null objects.

title: IGNITE-7105 .NET: Add IgniteLock
body:
* Add `IIgnite.GetOrCreateLock` (no `reentrant` because .NET locks are reentrant by default, this is expected)
* `IIgniteLock` methods are named according to standard `Monitor` class and existing Ignite `ICacheLock`
* Conditions and `*interruptibly` things are out of scope

- [x] The pull request title is treated as the final commit message. 
The following pattern must be used: `IGNITE-12407: Add Cluster API support to Java thin client`
- [ ] A reviewer has been mentioned through the JIRA comments 
(see [the Maintainers list](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/How+to+Contribute#HowtoContribute-ReviewProcessandMaintainers)) 
- [ ] The pull request has been checked by the Teamcity Bot and 
the `green visa` attached to the JIRA ticket (see [TC.Bot: Check PR](https://mtcga.gridgain.com/prs.html))
